byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Omar al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul.
byline.original: By FALIH HASSAN, OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Shiite cleric Moktada al-Sadr issues statement in which he orders hundreds of his followers to depart Green Zone in Baghdad, Iraq, day after they stormed government citadel to protest corruption; also demands that Parliament meet soon and approve a new cabinet.

headline.print_headline: Point Made, Cleric Orders Protesters to Leave Baghdad’s Green Zone
headline.main: Iraq Protesters Leave Baghdad Green Zone on Cleric’s Order

snippet: A day after his followers stormed the capital’s fortified core, the Shiite cleric Moktada al-Sadr demanded that Parliament meet soon to approve a new cabinet.
lead_paragraph: A day after his followers stormed the capital’s fortified core, the Shiite cleric Moktada al-Sadr demanded that Parliament meet soon to approve a new cabinet.
